Job Description: Bill of Rights Institute Director, Strategic Partnerships What you want… Do you love history and civics and want to secure investments in the future of civics education? Do you compete with yourself to exceed all your goals? If you would enjoy aggressively pursuing new revenue for a well-respected civics and history organization, this may be your dream job! How you describe yourself… Are you non-partisan but politically savvy? Someone with the proven ability to cultivate relationships in for-profit and not-for-profit circles. Do you understand and take pride in being someone who identifies opportunities and pursues them to achieve results? What we need… We seek a Strategic Partnerships Professional to partner with our highly competent, collegial, and growing fundraising team. We are looking for someone who understands how to establish and nurture high-level investors, how to honor our mission to serve teachers and students, and how to push our need for investments to fund our good works. Investors are stepping up to meet the need for solid civics and history education. Now is your chance to join the team that is among the leaders in this sector nationwide. Our products and services are respected, and our staff is passionate about our work. We constantly strive and succeed in producing best-in-class material, services, and resources for our teachers, students, and the community. An experienced professional will know how to use our reputation for excellence in this crucial field to attract investors. Responsibilities/ Expectations · Develop and grow the current significant investor base. · Identify new major gift prospects and close commitments. · Develop and maintain key long-term relationships with investors and prospects and cultivate significant gifts. · Work with the management team to identify funds needed, preferred funding targets, and approaches. · Create and execute a strategy for developing a large, sustained base of annual investors. · React quickly to changing investor expectations and business needs. Qualifications · Bachelor’s degree · 5-7 years of experience in donor relations and development; relevant connections within the field are essential. · Experience working with senior-level executives in a corporate or non-profit environment. · Strong interpersonal and partnership-building skills. · Ability and desire to interact with Investors regarding a broad base of issues related to Civic engagement and delivering quality K-12 education. · The ability to network with a broad and diverse group of civic-minded individuals, corporations, and other non-profit partners. · Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment while integrating high attention to detail, organization, and initiative. · High energy, upbeat, “can-do” attitude. · Outgoing entrepreneurial spirit. · Computer savvy and knowledge of database programs, particularly Salesforce. Bonus Points · Experience in a growing development department. · Proven success in both for-profit and non-profit fundraising. · Extraordinary ability to attract investors and “own” a conversation. What makes working for BRI so special? The Bill of Rights Institute has a unique organizational culture we value and support. Our culture is affirming and collegial. We are achievers. We enjoy working with each other; our interactions are positive, respectful, and filled with good humor. We reward excellence and achievement. We embrace all diversity in our work and our workforce.
